00018 /**
00019 
00020 @page ilk OCTEON II/OCTEON III Interlaken Interface
00021 
00022 This is a guide on how to experiment with the Interlaken (ILK) interfaces on
00023 EBB6800 and EBB7800 evaluation boards by Cavium Inc.
00024 
00025 @section ilk_hw_setup 1. HW Setup
00026 
00027 @subsection ilk_brd_req 2.1 Board Requirement
00028 
00029 The ILK interfaces can be tested with either a single EBB6800/EBB7800 board
00030 or two EBB6800/EBB7800 boards connected to each other. 
00031 
00032 @subsection ilk_cbl_conn 2.2 Cable Connections
00033 
00034 If a single EBB6800 board is used, QLM1 and QLM2 on the board need to be
00035 connected to each other via an external ILK cable. This is an externel HW 
00036 loopback configuration.
00037 
00038 If two EBB6800 boards are used, QLM1s on each board need to be connected to 
00039 each other with an ILK cable. QLM2s of both boards can also be connected to
00040 each other if both ILK interfaces need to be tested simultaneously. 
00041 
00042 For EBB7800, please refer to Hardware Reference Manual for possible
00043 combinations.
00044 
00045 @subsection ilk_mcu_conf 2.3 MCU Configuration for EBB6800
00046 
00047 Connect a null modem cable between a serial console and MCU DB-9 connector on
00048 EBB6800 board. Follow the screen instructions to allocate both QLM1 and QLM2 to
00049 CN68XX ILK interfaces and to specify the ILK lane speed.
00050 
00051 As an initial experiment, the ILK lane speed can be set at 3.125G. As a general
00052 rule, the higher the speed, the more difficult it is to realize a word boundary
00053 lock, due to signal skew.
00054 
00055 @subsection ilk_mcu_conf 2.4 MCU Configuration for EBB7800
00056 
00057 Connect a null modem cable between a serial console and MCU DB-9 connector on
00058 EBB7800 board. Follow the screen instructions to allocate supported QLMs
00059 based on the lanes to configure to ILK interfaces and to specify the ILK
00060 lane speed at 6.250G.
00061 
00062 @section ilk_run_sdk_sw_1bd 2. Running SDK SW for 1-Board Experiment
00063 
00064  - Source OCTEON_ROOT to be the base directory where OCTEON SDK is
00065    installed i.e. run the env-setup script.
00066  - Change to $OCTEON_ROOT/examples/traffic-gen. Build the traffic generator by
00067    issuing "make". The binary image will be "traffic-gen".
00068  - Power up the board. At the U-Boot prompt, issue the following commands to
00069    download and boot the traffic generator
00070     - tftp ${loadaddr} traffic-gen
00071     - bootoct ${loadaddr} numcores=32
00072  - At the traffic generator prompt, issue the following commands to send and
00073    receive ILK traffic, where "1024" (or 0x400) is the internal designation for
00074    the start of ILK #0 logical channels; "1283" (or 0x503) is the internal
00075    designation for the 4th logical channel of ILK #1. In general, ILK #0
00076    logical channels are numbered between 0x400 and 0x4FF; ILK #1 logical
00077    channels are numbered between 0x500 and 0x5FF
00078     - hide all
00079     - default 1024 1283
00080     - show
00081     - start
00082  - Now the ILK packet counts should show up in the console display. You should
00083    see ILK #0 channel 0 Tx counts matches with ILK #1 channel 0 Rx counts,
00084    ILK #0 channel 1 Tx counts matches with ILK #1 channel 1 Rx counts, and so
00085    on.
00086  - You can stop and restart ILK traffic by issuing "stop" then "start" again.
00087 
00088 @section ilk_run_sdk_sw_2bd 3. Running SDK SW for 2-Board Experiment
00089 
00090  - In addition to "traffic-gen", you need to build "passthrough" in a similar
00091    way in $OCTEON_ROOT/examples/passthrough directory.
00092  - Download and boot "traffic-gen" as in the 1-board experiment onto the 1st
00093    EBB6800 board. After the "traffic-gen" booted, download and boot
00094    "passthrough" onto the 2nd EBB6800 board in a similar way. Note <# of cores>
00095    on the "passthrough" side can be 1, 2, 4, 8, 16, or 32.
00096  - Start the ILK traffic as in the 1-board experiment. You should see ILK #0
00097    channel 0 Tx counts matches with ILK #0 channel 0 Rx counts, ILK #0 channel
00098    1 Tx counts matches with ILK #0 channel 1 Rx counts, and so on.
00099 
00100 @section ilk_known_limit 4. Known Limitations for EBB6800
00101 
00102 @subsection ilk_hi_qlm_spd 4.1 High QLM Speed
00103 
00104 At the highest lane speed 6.25G, a special cable may be needed to reduce signal
00105 skew. Otherwise, the word boundary lock may fail and the interfaces cannot be
00106 used.
00107 
00108 @subsection ilk_logic_chan 4.2 Limit on the number of ILK logical channels
00109 
00110 Only 4 channels on each ILK interface are tested. More testing is under way.
00111 However, the ultimate limit on the number of channels is the available port
00112 kinds. There are total 64 port kinds on CN68XX. each ILK channel takes one. The
00113 port kinds are also shared between ILK and other interfaces being used. The net
00114 port kinds available to ILK is around 45 max. This means there can be only 45
00115 logical channels for both ILK interfaces.
00116 
00117 @subsection ilk_la 4.3 Notes for look-aside mode
00118 
00119 ILK la mode is currently only supported in the CN68XX revision 2.0 and later.
00120 Receive calendar support is known to have problems in many cases such as two
00121 CN68XX devices connected back to back and should only be enabled in a limited
00122 set of circumstances.
00123 
00124 ILK la mode also restricts an interface to using channels 0 and 1.  Channel 0
00125 is required and channel 1 is optional.
00126 
00127 An 8-byte header of type cvmx_ilk_la_nsp_compact_hdr_t must be present at the
00128 beginning of every packet with bit 39 (la_mode) set to 1. If set to 0 then the
00129 packet will be sent in non LA-mode.
00130 
00131 All packets will be received on channels 128 and 129 even though they are sent
00132 on channels 0 and 1 if the la_mode bit is set.
00133 
00134 FCS is known not to work in LA mode. The PIP should be configured to disable 
00135 FCS checks as well as minimum length checks. The PKO can also disable FCS
00136 generation and set the minimum length to be as small as 8 bytes.
00137 
00138 All packets received will contain the 8-byte header defined by
00139 cvmx_ilk_la_nsp_compact_hdr_t in cvmx-ilk.h. The PIP can be configured to
00140 skip the 8-byte header.
00141 
00142 Two "weak" functions have been defined.  By weak, a user may create a new
00143 function with the same name and the linker will choose the non-weak function if
00144 it is present.  The functions are cvmx_ilk_use_la_mode(interface, channel) which
00145 returns 1 if LA mode is to be used.  If LA mode is to be used on an interface it
00146 MUST return 1 for channel 0. Channel 1 is optional.
00147 
00148 The other "weak" function is cvmx_ilk_la_mode_enable_rx_calendar which returns
00149 non-zero to enable the RX calendar.
00150 
00151 There are also several new defines for LA mode for executive-config.h.  These
00152 are CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_INTERFACE0, CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_INTERFACE1,
00153 CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_CAL_ENABLE_INTERFACE0 and
00154 CVMX_HELPER_ILK_LA_MODE_CAL_ENABLE_INTERFACE1.
00155 
00156 The traffic-gen example program has been enhanced to support LA mode.  It is
00157 recommended to not use the RX calendar with this application.
00158 
00159 @section ilk_api 5. ILK API under Simple Executive
00160 
00161  - __cvmx_helper_ilk_probe() - Probe a ILK interface and determine the number
00162    of ports connected to it. The ILK interface should still be down after this
00163    call.
00164  - __cvmx_helper_ilk_enable() - Bringup and enable ILK interface. After this
00165    call packet I/O should be fully functional. This is called with IPD enabled
00166    but PKO disabled.
00167  - __cvmx_helper_ilk_link_get() - Return the link state of an IPD/PKO port as
00168    returned by ILK link status.
00169  - __cvmx_helper_ilk_link_set() - Set the link state of an IPD/PKO port.
00170  - __cvmx_helper_ilk_show_stats() - Display ilk interface statistics.
00171  - cvmx_ilk_start_interface() - Initialize and start the ILK interface.
00172  - cvmx_ilk_start_interface_la - Initialize and start the ILK interface with look-aside support.
00173  - cvmx_ilk_set_pipe() - Set pipe group base and length for the interface.
00174  - cvmx_ilk_tx_set_channel() - Set logical channels for TX.
00175  - cvmx_ilk_rx_set_pknd() - Set pkind for RX.
00176  - cvmx_ilk_rx_cal_conf() - Configure calendar for RX.
00177  - cvmx_ilk_rx_set_hwm() - Set high water mark for RX.
00178  - cvmx_ilk_rx_cal_ena() - Enable calendar for RX.
00179  - cvmx_ilk_cal_setup_rx() - Set up calendar for RX.
00180  - cvmx_ilk_tx_cal_conf() - Configure calendar for TX.
00181  - cvmx_ilk_bp_conf() - Configure backpressure for TX.
00182  - cvmx_ilk_tx_cal_ena() - Enable calendar for TX.
00183  - cvmx_ilk_cal_setup_tx() - Set up calendar for TX.
00184  - cvmx_ilk_runtime_status() - Show run time status.
00185  - cvmx_ilk_enable() - Enable interface.
00186  - cvmx_ilk_disable() - Disable interface.
00187  - cvmx_ilk_get_intf_ena() - Provide interface enable status.
00188  - cvmx_ilk_get_chan_info() - Provide channel info.
00189  - cvmx_ilk_show_stats() - Show channel statistics.
00190  - cvmx_ilk_lpbk() - Enable or disable loopbacks.
00191  - cvmx_ilk_use_la_mode() - returns whether the interface and channel should use LA mode.
00192  - cvmx_ilk_la_mode_enable_rx_calendar() - returns if the interface should enable the rx calendar.
00193 */
